description: {"blocks":[{"key":"ctlfe","text":"Modified protocol based on that published by Nelson et al., 2024, 55(8):1190-1204.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"4m158","text":"Whatman #1 filter paper","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ahkp","text":"DI water","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3g7r4","text":"Funnels to hold filter paper","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ha8o","text":"Beaker or rack to hold filter paper (do not need to collect water)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2la4i","text":"Drying oven","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8pg2o","text":"Balance capable of weighing to 0.000g","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9l64m","text":"Trays to hold filter paper (that can withstand heat of oven!)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
protocol_references: {"blocks":[{"key":"3ja6n","text":"A Simple, Affordable, Do-It-Yourself Method for Measuring Soil Maximum Water Holding Capacity (tandfonline.com)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":111}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"59827DA538DA11EF85BD0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/epdf/10.1080/00103624.2023.2296988?needAccess=true"}}}}

status.info: We are still developing and optimizing this protocol

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5ule3","text":"Fold a Whatman #1 filter paper into quadrants to make a cone shape.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ija3","text":"Place into a conical funnel.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bbi6h","text":"Pre-saturate filter with DI water by dispensing water around the edges of the filter paper and allow excess to pass through.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9bls2","text":"Weigh soil plus wet filter paper and record mass to 0.000g. Also, record the mass of the wet, but drained filter (BF0).","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"efj6l","text":"Place soil and wet filter paper into an oven set to 105C and allow to dry overnight.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cbkkb","text":"After drying, cool tins for a minimum of 20 minutes. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cgqch","text":"After cooling, weigh dry soil plus filter paper and record mass to 0.000g. Also, record the mass of the dried filter (BF0)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"85n09","text":"Add 8.0g +/- 0.05g of air-dried soil to the wet filter paper. Use top-loading balance. You do not need to record the weight.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9pmtg","text":"Saturate soil by wetting the outer rim of the exposed filter paper so as not to disrupt the soil or cause crusting. A squirt bottle with a narrow tip works best.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":17,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9i7oi","text":"After the soil glistens or a small amount of water forms at the surface, stop adding water.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9j6g6","text":"Include one blank filter paper without soil and wet as a control to account for any evaporation (see equation below for more details).","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2eug6","text":"Cover funnels loosely with saran wrap (that you will use for weighing the wet filter paper) to minimize evaporation.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a994c","text":"Record time of saturation. Note: CTRL + SHIFT + semi-colon, is the short-cut to add the time in excel.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f3ccc","text":"Allow soils to drain for 6h.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d9fi7","text":"While samples are draining, weigh empty tins and record the tin id # and the mass to 0.000g.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5tqu6","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"53hv2","text":"MWHC = [SF6 + (BF0 - BF6)] - SFdry/ SFdry","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2880q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bai9r","text":"SF6 = mass in g of saturated and drained soil plus filter paper after 6 h drainage","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"189c0","text":"BF0 and BF6 = mass of dry filter and \"Blank\" filter with no soil but saturated after 6h to account for any water lost via evaporation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"111jb","text":"SFdry = mass of oven-dry soil plus oven-dry filter paper in g.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tex_formula","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"formula":"","guid":"","id":0}}}}

title: Water holding capacity by mass loss
title_html: Water holding capacity by mass loss
